Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 08:39AM maddyandzekesmom wrote: well the good news is that your getting a quick apt.  i had to wait a week to get an ultrasound and than another week to see the breast surgeon.  now i've waited two weeks since then to get my biopsy.  but you getting in so quick is a good sign that your process might be a little quicker and i'm sure most ladies would agree that waiting is the hardest part.  i don't have much advice since i'm just now still going through the process but from what i can tell there are just so many reasons for lumps that you'll know more what to ask once you've had an ultrasound.  hope this helps and keep us posted.  megan
Posts.Title: Lump found, not sure what to expect or do... Lanus Lanus

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2011 11:08PM maddyandzekesmom wrote: thank you all so much for your support.  i really needed it today.  gensi i know what you mean about a free card.  i thought with all the stupid stuff that has happened lately i'd be free of stuff for awhile.  i know thats so silly.  the only positive side is that my husband agreed that we can move to where my family is if i am sick.  still hopeful that i;m not.  but where my family lives is near boston so the health options would be much better than where i;m at.  thanks so much again and i'll keep you all posted on whats going on.  megan
Posts.Title: Didn't realize.... maddyandzekesmom FindingMyself

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2011 04:02AM maddyandzekesmom wrote: ok i just got back from my biopsy.  everything went well.  i'm a little sleepy but besides that i;m not in any pain yet.  but the medicine hasn't worn off.  just taking it easy.  anyway the doctor told me that it actually wasn't a solid mass it was a cyst.  he said that the liquid was so thick inside, he even compared it to mud.  that was why it showed up the way it did.  i have to wait till next week week for results.  but from what i can tell online its a complex cyst.  does anyone have any experience with this.  i'm glad its just a cyst.  but this complex cyst makes me nervous.  any one had this?  thanks again  megan
Posts.Title: Didn't realize.... maddyandzekesmom FindingMyself

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2011 01:19PM maddyandzekesmom wrote: of course it would. we are all scared.  its hard feeling helpless.  there is this thing in our body and you just want it out.  and all we want is answers.  everyone is working as quick as they can but its never quick enough.  i hope everything goes well.  keep me posted.  just found out that i have to till thursday for results.  i'm trying to stay busy.
Posts.Title: diagnostic u/s, mammo, and possible biopsy Thursday - questions Napaoctober maddyandzekesmom

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2011 12:25PM maddyandzekesmom wrote: i know how you feel.  i was in a situation like that.  i actually had a hard lump.  but there has been so much waiting.  i'd tell you to be patient but i haven't been.  the good news is if they do the ultrasound and the biopsy that day you may get your results back anywhere from 2-7 days.  most places are 2.  so you may have a pretty quick time getting some answers.  they can usually get the right spot by using an ultrasound while doing the needle biopsy.  i actually ended up having a complex cyst which was surgically taken out.  i'm waiting on the results 4 days and counting.  but 2 were on the weekend.   just so your prepared if they can't do a biopsy then you may need to wait to see a breast surgeon who will go over your options.  needle or surgical biopsy.  then you may have to wait to actually have which ever one you choose.  i'm not saying this is how it goes in all cases but that is how it was for me.  since i got the lump its been about 4 1/2 weeks and i'm about to get my results.  i'm just telling you this so you don't get disappointed if you don't get this all wrapped up right away.  i was when i didn't get all my answers at the ultrasound.  hope this helps.  keep us posted
Posts.Title: diagnostic u/s, mammo, and possible biopsy Thursday - questions Napaoctober maddyandzekesmom
